entry.title: Silicon Valley Bank Contagion: Crypto Companies Affected Include BlockFi, Circle, Avalanche
entry.summary: BlockFi, Circle, Avalanche, Yuga Labs, and Proof are among the crypto names that had exposure to now-shuttered Silicon Valley Bank.

entry.title: As Silicon Valley Bank Falls, Crypto Firms Brace for 'Extinction-Level' Tech Startup Turmoil
entry.summary: The effects of Silicon Valley Bank's failure are only beginning to be felt. Here's what's going on.

entry.title: Brave Browser Now Lets Users Sell Crypto Within the Wallet
entry.summary: The privacy-centric browser is trying to boost crypto self-custody by providing an off-ramp within its integrated wallet.

entry.title: Coinbase Updates Staking Service Following Regulatory Crackdown
entry.summary: The exchange has made changes to the way staked assets can be transferred and sold, emphasizing that customers earn rewards via protocols and not from Coinbase.

entry.title: Gotta Catch NFTs? The Pokémon Company Is Hiring a Web3 Expert
entry.summary: The company behind the massively popular Nintendo video game series could be exploring Web3 moves, based on a new job listing.

entry.title: Biden’s Tax Hike Proposal and What It Means for Bitcoin 'Wash Sales'
entry.summary: The president’s ambitious tax plan has new rules for digital assets—how will it affect the ordinary trader?

entry.title: California Financial Regulator Shutters Silicon Valley Bank
entry.summary: Silicon Valley Bank was closed by California's financial regulator and insured depositors can expect to withdraw their money by Monday.

entry.title: Breakout NFT Conference is Building Web3 Communities in São Paulo
entry.summary: The Breakout NFT conference is a first-of-its-kind meeting of the minds for Web3 builders and leaders in Brazil.

entry.title: Embattled Silicon Valley Bank Seeking Outside Acquisition: Report
entry.summary: Trading for SVB Financial has been suspended as the parent company behind Silicon Valley Bank is reportedly seeking a buyout.

entry.title: Voyager Liquidates $56M in Ethereum, SHIB, and Other ERC-20 Tokens
entry.summary: On-chain analytics indicate that the now-bankrupt Voyager has been steadily selling various assets, including Ethereum and Shiba Inu.

entry.title: Bitcoin Plummets 8% as Crypto Market Falls Below $1 Trillion
entry.summary: Bitcoin plunged below $20,000 for the first time since mid-January as multiple factors placed increased pressure on the crypto industry.

entry.title: People Are Minting 'BRC-20' Meme Tokens on Bitcoin via Ordinals
entry.summary: Ordinal inscriptions hit a new daily peak Thursday after someone figured out how to mint a form of "fungible tokens" on Bitcoin.

entry.title: Congressman Warns Digital Dollar Could Expand 'Financial Control' Over Americans
entry.summary: Rep. Tom Emmer says he has strong concerns that a CBDC could jeopardize American civil liberties.

entry.title: Peter Thiel-Backed Block.one Says it Sold Off Silvergate Stake
entry.summary: The startup behind EOS said that it exited its position in the soon-to-shutter "crypto-friendly" bank—at an apparently sizable loss.

entry.title: GQ Magazine NFT Drop Flops—And the Floor Is Falling Fast
entry.summary: The GQ3 NFT passes are now selling for about half the original price as the men’s lifestyle magazine says it will reward holders.

entry.title: New York Attorney General Sues KuCoin, Claims Ethereum Is a Security
entry.summary: The New York AG seeks to block access to the crypto exchange in the state.

entry.title: Signature Bank’s Stock Sinks 10% as Silvergate Prepares to Shut Down
entry.summary: Things are looking grim for the U.S.-based, crypto-friendly banks.

entry.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity
entry.summary: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.

entry.title: Starbucks Serves Up Its First Premium NFTs at $100 a Pop
entry.summary: After its free NFTs garnered significant value, the Polygon-based Starbucks Odyssey platform is dropping its first paid collectible.

entry.title: Token Sniffer Adds API for Faster Scam Scans
entry.summary: Solidus Labs says it has found more than 250,000 rug pulls since 2021—a new scam token created every 4 minutes.

entry.title: Cryptocurrency Subreddit Launches New MOON Token Pool on SushiSwap
entry.summary: Following a recent governance proposal, SushiSwap is rolling out a new rewards program in partnership with r/CryptoCurrency.

entry.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'
entry.summary: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.

entry.title: FCA, Met Police Continue Bitcoin ATM Crackdown in East London
entry.summary: The UK Financial Conduct Authority continues to target and disrupt illegal Bitcoin ATM businesses, this time it's taking aim at London.

entry.title: Planet Hollywood, Animoca Brands to Launch NFT Club in L.A.
entry.summary: The theme restaurant chain is expanding its Web3 presence via a new members-only launch with Animoca Brands.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Down 8% on the Week as Silvergate Bank Shuts Shop
entry.summary: Bitcoin and major altcoins slipped further following the news of crypto-friendly bank Silvergate winding down operations.

entry.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past
entry.summary: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.

entry.title: Regulatory Uncertainty and Fed’s Next Steps Keep Bitcoin Traders Cautious
entry.summary: Ongoing market uncertainty means traders are either selling or staying still.

entry.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'
entry.summary: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."

entry.title: CFTC Chair Says Ethereum Is a Commodity—Despite Gensler’s ‘Bitcoin Only’ Position
entry.summary: Rostin Behnam parts ways with his SEC counterpart over federal jurisdiction over ETH.

entry.title: Lionel Messi Backs Web3 Soccer Game Startup Matchday in $21M Round
entry.summary: The studio is working with FIFA and plans to build Web3 games with the support of pro soccer superstar Lionel Messi's VC firm Play Time.

entry.title: 'Crypto Friendly' Bank Silvergate to Wind Down Operations
entry.summary: Citing regulatory headwinds and the bear market, Silvergate Capital announced it is shuttering Silvergate Bank.

entry.title: Vitalik Buterin Has an NFT Collection? Quadratic Funding Drop Pulls In Millions
entry.summary: Surprised NFT traders are flocking to the NFT project, which includes hand-signed documents from the Ethereum creator.

entry.title: Bitcoin Twitter Taunts Paul Krugman Over TradFi Troubles
entry.summary: "The software has taken control," he lamented, but crypto Twitter had thoughts.

entry.title: Mutant Apes Meet Dungeons & Dragons in Web3 Game 'The Glimmering'
entry.summary: Mutant Ape Yacht Club characters are being enlisted as villains for the D&D-inspired game.

entry.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young
entry.summary: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.

entry.title: Fed Chair Ponders Potential for Digital Dollar to Send Bitcoin to Zero
entry.summary: Congressman Lynch is worried about a CBDC's impact on crypto. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said he wonders why most cryptocurrencies currently have any value at all.

entry.title: Heterosis NFT Art Project Not ‘Possible in Any Other Medium': Mat Collishaw
entry.summary: Step into the stunning digital garden of Heterosis, the latest project by veteran artist Mat Collishaw as he dives into the world of NFTs.

entry.title: Coinbase Announces ‘Wallet as a Service,’ Hints at ‘Household Name’ Partners
entry.summary: Coinbase continues to court developers with new tools to embed digital wallets in any app.

entry.title: Vitalik Buterin’s Fund Donates $15M in USDC to Airborne Pathogen Research
entry.summary: The latest $15 million donation adds to the Ethereum co-founder’s efforts to fund COVID-19-related scientific research.

entry.title: Environmental Impact of Bitcoin Mining ‘Deserves the Spotlight’: US Senator Markey
entry.summary: The U.S. Senate yesterday held what lawmakers said was its first-ever hearing on the environmental impact of crypto mining.

entry.title: Mt. Gox Creditors Have Until Friday to File Repayment Claims
entry.summary: Former customers can recoup up to 90% of their losses under the rehabilitation proposal.

entry.title: Why IEX of ‘Flash Boys’ Fame Launched Web3 Marketing Platform Dispatch
entry.summary: Blockchain technology and Web3 let companies engage with users beyond initial purchases, argues Dispatch head of product Sean Spector.

entry.title: Jack Dorsey's Block Reveals Plans for Bitcoin 'Mining Development Kit'
entry.summary: The company hopes to see developers integrate mining into heating solutions, off-grid mining, home mining, and intermittent power applications.

entry.title: Binance US Cleared to Buy Voyager Assets as Judge Dismisses SEC Objections
entry.summary: U.S. bankruptcy judge Michael Wiles has given Binance US the green light, but the deal is not yet final.

entry.title: Ex-Riot Games Execs Raise $55M for New Studio, Say ‘No Fucking Thanks’ to NFTs
entry.summary: The Believer Company has garnered investment from Web3-friendly VC firms, but isn't interested in using NFTs.

entry.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs
entry.summary: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
